III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance provided at this time because none was
required. The facility is in the process of changing over to an electronic system for
record keeping and they understand the information that needs to be added to this
new system to stay in compliance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested by the facility nor was any required at this time.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The single violation was of Rule 400.4114 and involved one employee file without
documentatino of the required annual TB testing. The action step taken is to have
the Administrative Assistant notify the employee to complete the task of the TB
testing 60-days prior to their due date for the testing. The supervisor will also be
made aware of the upcoming due date for the testing. This issue was not found to
be of concern during this inspection.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator (CA) addressed the CAP required from the 2022 Renewal
inspection and she outlined the action steps that have helped the facility stay in
compliance over the reporting period. She also addressed the CAP dated 2/2022 in
regard to the Special Investigation 2022C0328003 in which the facility failed to
inform the licensing authority of a youth who had gone AWOL. The facility’s action
steps are outlined, and it appears they have been complying since the incident. The
agency struggles to hire staff and the efforts have been made to overcome these
barriers. The facility has been able to reach the goal of being fully staffed by
6/2023. The CA identified since completing the required CAPs they have been able
to obtain full compliance. The executive Director, Social Services Supervisor,
Shelter Supervisor, and Therapist Supervisor meet weekly to address concerns
related to youth files, policy, and/or general concerns. Leadership meets at least
monthly to review policy and process any overarching issues that may arise. The
current CA is new and began this position just prior to this inspection. She met all of
the requirements and has a wealth of knowledge and experience in providing
services to youth.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff report feeling supported by administration and feel very comfortable with the
new CA. The believe she will provide an excellent source of information and
support to the staff and youth at the facility. They identified the training provided as
helpful and look forward to future training to enhance their ability to be supportive of
3

the youth in their care. The single youth in the program at the time of this inspection
reported feeling safe and cared for at the facility. They also reported staff are very
supportive and the facility is helping them develop the skills necessary to move on
with their life.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is single level older structure which has been maintained. The facility is
furnished appropriate, and all plumbing is in working order. The facility has ample
food supplies with both fresh fruit and vegetables. The menu is posted as is the
emergency number. The overnight room check logs and emergency logs were
reviewed and both meet compliance. Fire extinguishers are up to date.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
